TopicTitle: What do you think is next (.24)

Articles.Content:
(Wait? Already!)

Yes

What do you think the next update will bring!

My guess

* reputation for kerbals

* more biomes ( most Likely Duna/eve)

* moar science!/labs

Post what you think is next.
That was quick.
I think HarvesteR commented during KerbalKon that they'll be working on the economy and contracts for 0.24. Other than that, I don't know
What Kasper said. Go play 0.23.

What Kasper said. Go play 0.23.

Ok..... ....but do I have to??
Yes. All day long!
Yes, I think next to come is 0.24.
I'd like to see more regions (sorry, but using the word biomes for sterile planetary bodies is a personal heresy ) on Eve, Duna and Laythe.

Yup - economy and contracts!

Really looking forward to that.

Seriously... when are they going to work on aerodynamics? That's the thing I'm looking forward to... And don't tell me to use FAR! I don't like using mods.

TBH, Career mode (and multiplayer) don't hold much interest for me, but I'll allow that I'm in the minority. Still...

Yes, I think next to come is 0.24.

I think we will get 0.23.1 first.

And new planet.
Whatever it is, it promises to be good because it's coming from Squad.
Nobody knows yet. Now go play 0.23.

They "must" focus on optimization. I have a Late 2013 MBP, and computer can't handle game :S Everyone waiting new parts, new science parts or things, improved IVA. Me too. But, first optimization. I think 64 bit support will be really good.

An economy and possibly missions.

What I want?

Always and forever RESOURCES!

Seriously... when are they going to work on aerodynamics? That's the thing I'm looking forward to...

Indeed, that's what I'm asking myself too and resources, but I guess someone will make a mod (that is better than Kethane) for it.

Personally i'd like to see more biomes/regions, or interactions with anomalies. Basically anything that promotes surface exploration and more EV activities.

Speaking of anomalies, hopefully they will get fixed at some point too. I imagine that isn't a priority for a while though, I don't know how complicated it would be but since it hasn't already been done already it's probably more involved and problematic than we think.

And don't tell me to use FAR! I don't like using mods.

Many parts of the game are built on the same APIs available to 3rd parties. i.e., you are already playing with mods and it didn't hurt at all.

I'd like to see in 0.24:

1) IVA with the new lab module. My kerbals who venture inside just appear to disappear / become one with the module.

2) Biomes on Duna and its moon

3) More sensors for science. How about long-term science gathering... such as a mapping mission? make stations have more of a purpose.

It hasn't even been a full 24 hours at posting time. Props on the enthusiasm, though As things carry on, I look forward to collecting your opinions on what should come next - other than what HarvesteR's mentioned, of course.

I think HarvesteR commented during KerbalKon that they'll be working on the economy and contracts for 0.24. Other than that, I don't know

MONEY! Oh yeah!

MONEY! Oh yeah!

Tell you what, economics is going to force me to be a better player. Most of my stuff could be considered over-engineered, but who cares as long as it works, right?

That attitude won't fly with money involved.

Many parts of the game are built on the same APIs available to 3rd parties. i.e., you are already playing with mods and it didn't hurt at all.

There's a distinct difference there. Many people want to experience the game as the developer intended and released it. Those third party apis are still part of the base game, whereas FAR and kethane are not. They're not mods, any more than any assets SQUAD don't make and own, like, say, the orbit music, are.

I'd like to see suborbital / atmospheric research included.

The X-1, X-15 and later transonic / supersonic / hypersonic and high-altitude research programs were crucial to NASA's progression from the pre-Mercury era to the success of the Apollo program.

Plus, it'd be a really cool way to do science. And watching Jeb grin like an idiot at the equivalent of Mach 3 is awesome.

MONEY! Oh yeah!

money money money

always funny
